text: In 2 sibs, born of distantly related Pakistani parents, with 3-hydroxyisobutyryl-CoA hydrolase deficiency (HIBCHD; 250620), Ferdinandusse et al. (2013) identified a homozygous c.950G-A transition in the HIBCH gene (c.950G-A, NM_014362.2), resulting in a gly317-to-glu (G317E) substitution at a highly conserved residue. The mutation, which was found by direct sequencing of the HIBCH gene, segregated with the disorder in the family and was not found in the dbSNP or 1000 Genomes Project databases. Fibroblast activity of HIBCH was below the level of detection in both patients.
